originalText.text: Wow! That is all I can say...I have been to the 6th ave location(waiting for the uws location,my neighborhood,to open since i got Lucy), which was great for my Pup. I took her there at 10 weeks old from her first training class to her first puppy cut. Now at 5 months old and a 6 day trip planned i had to board her...Scared ****less i left her there and could not be happier. The staff, just like the other locations were awesome! I got tons of photos(see below) sent to me, checked her out on the web cam when i was gone, saw her reach celebrity status on their fb page lol. Highly recommend!

originalText.text: We love Prae our groomer and our pup Stella loves her! We are so lucky! Thank you Prae for taking such great care of our girl!! Highly recommend!

text.text: We love Prae our groomer and our pup Stella loves her! We are so lucky! Thank you Prae for taking such great care of our girl!! Highly recommend!

originalText.text:
I can't say enough positive things about D is for Doggy! Our dog, Ralphie, has been going to daycare here for over a year and it is his FAVORITE place ever. The staff is amazing and they treat every dog as if they were their own. Ralphie never wants to leave - it's like doggy Disneyland (they even decorate for Halloween, Christmas, etc.!). We've left Ralphie overnight here for both weekend trips and 2-week vacations, and every time has been a success. He has separation anxiety, so boarding at D is for Doggy is perfect because he's never left alone and never put in a crate. The staff is fantastic with following with specific food and medication instructions.

Ralphie also gets groomed here and Jesus does an amazing job. He is so sweet and patient with dogs who hate getting groomed.

I've referred many other dog owners to D is for Doggy, so I felt it was high time I leave a review. Run your dog here ASAP!

originalText.text:
There's no better place to bring your dog. The ENTIRE staff are kind, generous, and caring for the pets. My guy started as a one-year-old there, scared of leaving us and of dogs in the other rooms. Now, he runs there and happily jumps on and greets every person that works there, and bolts to the back to meet his friends.
Couldn't recommend D is for Doggy more

originalText.text:
I really like D is for Doggy’s staff and how much they seem to care about my pup. However, I think their boarding service might not be suited for some pups that can’t handle being around many dogs at a time. And that’s my main concern with their boarding: it’s too many dogs for a handler to look out for at a time. You can see it in the cameras too: handlers get overwhelmed and don’t/can’t pay attention to every dog (and this might after dogs that need attention or that might not be friendly with all dogs).

On that note, it’s hard to know the type of dogs that come in and out of boarding, so if your pup is not used to being social and friendly with EVERY dog (type) I would highly recommend you to think about leaving your pup elsewhere. Again, there are could be so many dogs boarding the same time, that it’s impossible to know if a dogs particular behavior could trigger something.
